title: GitHub
description: Powerful collaboration, code review, and code management for open source and private projects.

oauth_2_0.label:
OAuth2 is a protocol that lets external apps request authorization to private
details in a user's GitHub account without getting their password. This is
preferred over Basic Authentication because tokens can be limited to specific
types of data, and can be revoked by users at any time.

get_emojis.title: Lists all the emojis available to use on GitHub.
get_emojis.description: Lists all the emojis available to use on GitHub.

get_feeds.title:
List Feeds.
GitHub provides several timeline resources in Atom format. The Feeds API
 lists all the feeds available to the authenticating user.
get_feeds.description:
List Feeds.
GitHub provides several timeline resources in Atom format. The Feeds API
 lists all the feeds available to the authenticating user.

get_gists.title:
List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will
return all public gists.
get_gists.description:
List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will
return all public gists.

get_gists_starred.title: List the authenticated user's starred gists.
get_gists_starred.description: List the authenticated user's starred gists.

get_gists__id__star.title: Check if a gist is starred.
get_gists__id__star.description: Check if a gist is starred.

get_gitignore_templates.title:
Listing available templates.
List all templates available to pass as an option when creating a repository.
get_gitignore_templates.description:
Listing available templates.
List all templates available to pass as an option when creating a repository.

get_issues.title:
List issues.
List all issues across all the authenticated user's visible repositories.
get_issues.description:
List issues.
List all issues across all the authenticated user's visible repositories.

get_legacy_issues_search__owner___reposi.title: Find issues by state and keyword.
get_legacy_issues_search__owner___reposi.description: Find issues by state and keyword.

get_legacy_repos_search__keyword_.title: Find repositories by keyword. Note, this legacy method does not follow the v3 pagination pattern. This method returns up to 100 results per page and pages can be fetched using the start_page parameter.
get_legacy_repos_search__keyword_.description: Find repositories by keyword. Note, this legacy method does not follow the v3 pagination pattern. This method returns up to 100 results per page and pages can be fetched using the start_page parameter.

get_legacy_user_email__email_.title: This API call is added for compatibility reasons only.
get_legacy_user_email__email_.description: This API call is added for compatibility reasons only.

post_markdown_raw.title: Render a Markdown document in raw mode
post_markdown_raw.description: Render a Markdown document in raw mode

get_meta.title: This gives some information about GitHub.com, the service.
get_meta.description: This gives some information about GitHub.com, the service.

get_networks__owner___repo__events.title: List public events for a network of repositories.
get_networks__owner___repo__events.description: List public events for a network of repositories.

get_notifications.title:
List your notifications.
List all notifications for the current user, grouped by repository.
get_notifications.description:
List your notifications.
List all notifications for the current user, grouped by repository.

put_notifications.title:
Mark as read.
Marking a notification as "read" removes it from the default view on GitHub.com.
put_notifications.description:
Mark as read.
Marking a notification as "read" removes it from the default view on GitHub.com.

put_notifications_threads__id__subscript.title:
Set a Thread Subscription.
This lets you subscribe to a thread, or ignore it. Subscribing to a thread
is unnecessary if the user is already subscribed to the repository. Ignoring
a thread will mute all future notifications (until you comment or get @mentioned).
put_notifications_threads__id__subscript.description:
Set a Thread Subscription.
This lets you subscribe to a thread, or ignore it. Subscribing to a thread
is unnecessary if the user is already subscribed to the repository. Ignoring
a thread will mute all future notifications (until you comment or get @mentioned).

get_orgs__org__events.title: List public events for an organization.
get_orgs__org__events.description: List public events for an organization.

get_orgs__org__issues.title:
List issues.
List all issues for a given organization for the authenticated user.
get_orgs__org__issues.description:
List issues.
List all issues for a given organization for the authenticated user.

get_orgs__org__members.title:
Members list.
List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user tha
belongs to at least 1 team in the organization. If the authenticated user
is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public members
will be returned. If the requester is not an owner of the organization the
query will be redirected to the public members list.
get_orgs__org__members.description:
Members list.
List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user tha
belongs to at least 1 team in the organization. If the authenticated user
is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public members
will be returned. If the requester is not an owner of the organization the
query will be redirected to the public members list.

delete_orgs__org__members__username_.title:
Remove a member.
Removing a user from this list will remove them from all teams and they
will no longer have any access to the organization's repositories.
delete_orgs__org__members__username_.description:
Remove a member.
Removing a user from this list will remove them from all teams and they
will no longer have any access to the organization's repositories.

get_orgs__org__members__username_.title: Check if a user is, publicly or privately, a member of the organization.
get_orgs__org__members__username_.description: Check if a user is, publicly or privately, a member of the organization.

get_orgs__org__public_members.title:
Public members list.
Members of an organization can choose to have their membership publicized
or not.
get_orgs__org__public_members.description:
Public members list.
Members of an organization can choose to have their membership publicized
or not.

get_orgs__org__repos.title: List repositories for the specified org.
get_orgs__org__repos.description: List repositories for the specified org.

post_orgs__org__repos.title:
Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply
repo scope.
post_orgs__org__repos.description:
Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply
repo scope.

post_orgs__org__teams.title:
Create team.
In order to create a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of organization.
post_orgs__org__teams.description:
Create team.
In order to create a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of organization.

get_rate_limit.title:
Get your current rate limit status
Note: Accessing this endpoint does not count against your rate limit.
get_rate_limit.description:
Get your current rate limit status
Note: Accessing this endpoint does not count against your rate limit.

delete_repos__owner___repo_.title:
Delete a Repository.
Deleting a repository requires admin access. If OAuth is used, the delete_repo
scope is required.
delete_repos__owner___repo_.description:
Delete a Repository.
Deleting a repository requires admin access. If OAuth is used, the delete_repo
scope is required.

get_repos__owner___repo__assignees.title:
List assignees.
This call lists all the available assignees (owner + collaborators) to which
issues may be assigned.
get_repos__owner___repo__assignees.description:
List assignees.
This call lists all the available assignees (owner + collaborators) to which
issues may be assigned.

get_repos__owner___repo__assignees__assi.title:
Check assignee.
You may also check to see if a particular user is an assignee for a repository.
get_repos__owner___repo__assignees__assi.description:
Check assignee.
You may also check to see if a particular user is an assignee for a repository.

get_repos__owner___repo__collaborators.title:
List.
When authenticating as an organization owner of an organization-owned
repository, all organization owners are included in the list of
collaborators. Otherwise, only users with access to the repository are
returned in the collaborators list.
get_repos__owner___repo__collaborators.description:
List.
When authenticating as an organization owner of an organization-owned
repository, all organization owners are included in the list of
collaborators. Otherwise, only users with access to the repository are
returned in the collaborators list.

get_repos__owner___repo__collaborators__.title: Check if user is a collaborator
get_repos__owner___repo__collaborators__.description: Check if user is a collaborator

get_repos__owner___repo__comments.title:
List commit comments for a repository.
Comments are ordered by ascending ID.
get_repos__owner___repo__comments.description:
List commit comments for a repository.
Comments are ordered by ascending ID.

get_repos__owner___repo__commits__ref__s.title:
Get the combined Status for a specific Ref
The Combined status endpoint is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the blog post for full details.
To access this endpoint during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header:
application/vnd.github.she-hulk-preview+json
get_repos__owner___repo__commits__ref__s.description:
Get the combined Status for a specific Ref
The Combined status endpoint is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the blog post for full details.
To access this endpoint during the preview period, you must provide a custom media type in the Accept header:
application/vnd.github.she-hulk-preview+json

get_repos__owner___repo__commits__shaCod.title: List comments for a single commitList comments for a single commit.
get_repos__owner___repo__commits__shaCod.description: List comments for a single commitList comments for a single commit.

delete_repos__owner___repo__contents__pa.title:
Delete a file.
This method deletes a file in a repository.
delete_repos__owner___repo__contents__pa.description:
Delete a file.
This method deletes a file in a repository.

get_repos__owner___repo__contents__path_.title:
Get contents.
This method returns the contents of a file or directory in a repository.
Files and symlinks support a custom media type for getting the raw content.
Directories and submodules do not support custom media types.
Note: This API supports files up to 1 megabyte in size.
Here can be many outcomes. For details see "http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/"
get_repos__owner___repo__contents__path_.description:
Get contents.
This method returns the contents of a file or directory in a repository.
Files and symlinks support a custom media type for getting the raw content.
Directories and submodules do not support custom media types.
Note: This API supports files up to 1 megabyte in size.
Here can be many outcomes. For details see "http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/"

get_repos__owner___repo__deployments.title: Users with pull access can view deployments for a repository
get_repos__owner___repo__deployments.description: Users with pull access can view deployments for a repository

post_repos__owner___repo__deployments.title: Users with push access can create a deployment for a given ref
post_repos__owner___repo__deployments.description: Users with push access can create a deployment for a given ref

get_repos__owner___repo__deployments__id.title: Users with pull access can view deployment statuses for a deployment
get_repos__owner___repo__deployments__id.description: Users with pull access can view deployment statuses for a deployment

Create a Deployment Status

post_repos__owner___repo__deployments__i.description:

get_repos__owner___repo__downloads.title: Deprecated. List downloads for a repository.
get_repos__owner___repo__downloads.description: Deprecated. List downloads for a repository.

post_repos__owner___repo__forks.title:
Create a fork.
Forking a Repository happens asynchronously. Therefore, you may have to wai
a short period before accessing the git objects. If this takes longer than 5
minutes, be sure to contact Support.
post_repos__owner___repo__forks.description:
Create a fork.
Forking a Repository happens asynchronously. Therefore, you may have to wai
a short period before accessing the git objects. If this takes longer than 5
minutes, be sure to contact Support.

get_repos__owner___repo__git_blobs__shaC.title:
Get a Blob.
Since blobs can be any arbitrary binary data, the input and responses for
the blob API takes an encoding parameter that can be either utf-8 or
base64. If your data cannot be losslessly sent as a UTF-8 string, you can
base64 encode it.
get_repos__owner___repo__git_blobs__shaC.description:
Get a Blob.
Since blobs can be any arbitrary binary data, the input and responses for
the blob API takes an encoding parameter that can be either utf-8 or
base64. If your data cannot be losslessly sent as a UTF-8 string, you can
base64 encode it.

delete_repos__owner___repo__git_refs__re.title:
Delete a Reference
Example: Deleting a branch: DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/heads/feature-a 
Example: Deleting a tag:        DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/tags/v1.0
delete_repos__owner___repo__git_refs__re.description:
Delete a Reference
Example: Deleting a branch: DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/heads/feature-a 
Example: Deleting a tag:        DELETE /repos/octocat/Hello-World/git/refs/tags/v1.0

post_repos__owner___repo__git_tags.title:
Create a Tag Object.
Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a
tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do
this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag]
reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create
the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.
post_repos__owner___repo__git_tags.description:
Create a Tag Object.
Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a
tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do
this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag]
reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create
the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

post_repos__owner___repo__git_trees.title:
Create a Tree.
The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and
a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the
contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.
post_repos__owner___repo__git_trees.description:
Create a Tree.
The tree creation API will take nested entries as well. If both a tree and
a nested path modifying that tree are specified, it will overwrite the
contents of that tree with the new path contents and write a new tree out.

post_repos__owner___repo__hooks__hookId_.title:
Test a push hook.
This will trigger the hook with the latest push to the current repository
if the hook is subscribed to push events. If the hook is not subscribed
to push events, the server will respond with 204 but no test POST will
be generated.
Note: Previously /repos/:owner/:repo/hooks/:id/tes
post_repos__owner___repo__hooks__hookId_.description:
Test a push hook.
This will trigger the hook with the latest push to the current repository
if the hook is subscribed to push events. If the hook is not subscribed
to push events, the server will respond with 204 but no test POST will
be generated.
Note: Previously /repos/:owner/:repo/hooks/:id/tes

post_repos__owner___repo__issues.title:
Create an issue.
Any user with pull access to a repository can create an issue.
post_repos__owner___repo__issues.description:
Create an issue.
Any user with pull access to a repository can create an issue.

get_repos__owner___repo__issues_events.title: List issue events for a repository.
get_repos__owner___repo__issues_events.description: List issue events for a repository.

patch_repos__owner___repo__issues__numbe.title:
Edit an issue.
Issue owners and users with push access can edit an issue.
patch_repos__owner___repo__issues__numbe.description:
Edit an issue.
Issue owners and users with push access can edit an issue.

delete_repos__owner___repo__issues__numb.title: Remove all labels from an issue.
delete_repos__owner___repo__issues__numb.description: Remove all labels from an issue.

put_repos__owner___repo__issues__number_.title:
Replace all labels for an issue.
Sending an empty array ([]) will remove all Labels from the Issue.
put_repos__owner___repo__issues__number_.description:
Replace all labels for an issue.
Sending an empty array ([]) will remove all Labels from the Issue.

delete_repos__owner___repo__issues__numb.title: Remove a label from an issue.
delete_repos__owner___repo__issues__numb.description: Remove a label from an issue.

get_repos__owner___repo__labels.title: List all labels for this repository.
get_repos__owner___repo__labels.description: List all labels for this repository.

get_repos__owner___repo__languages.title:
List languages.
List languages for the specified repository. The value on the right of a
language is the number of bytes of code written in that language.
get_repos__owner___repo__languages.description:
List languages.

get_repos__owner___repo__milestones__num.title: Get labels for every issue in a milestone.

List your notifications in a repository
List all notifications for the current user.

put_repos__owner___repo__notifications.title:
Mark notifications as read in a repository.
Marking all notifications in a repository as "read" removes them from the
default view on GitHub.com.

Mark notifications as read in a repository.

List comments in a repository.
By default, Review Comments are ordered by ascending ID.

get_repos__owner___repo__pulls__number__.description: Get if a pull request has been merged.

get_repos__owner___repo__releases.title: Users with push access to the repository will receive all releases (i.e., published releases and draft releases). Users with pull access will receive published releases only
get_repos__owner___repo__releases.description: Users with push access to the repository will receive all releases (i.e., published releases and draft releases). Users with pull access will receive published releases only

Create a release

Edit a release asset

get_repos__owner___repo__stats_code_freq.title:
Get the number of additions and deletions per week.
Returns a weekly aggregate of the number of additions and deletions pushed
to a repository.
get_repos__owner___repo__stats_code_freq.description:
Get the number of additions and deletions per week.
Returns a weekly aggregate of the number of additions and deletions pushed
to a repository.

get_repos__owner___repo__stats_commit_ac.title:
Get the last year of commit activity data.
Returns the last year of commit activity grouped by week. The days array
is a group of commits per day, starting on Sunday.
get_repos__owner___repo__stats_commit_ac.description:
Get the last year of commit activity data.
Returns the last year of commit activity grouped by week. The days array
is a group of commits per day, starting on Sunday.

get_repos__owner___repo__stats_contribut.title: Get contributors list with additions, deletions, and commit counts.
get_repos__owner___repo__stats_contribut.description: Get contributors list with additions, deletions, and commit counts.

get_repos__owner___repo__stats_participa.title: Get the weekly commit count for the repo owner and everyone else.
get_repos__owner___repo__stats_participa.description: Get the weekly commit count for the repo owner and everyone else.

get_repos__owner___repo__stats_punch_car.title:
Get the number of commits per hour in each day.
Each array contains the day number, hour number, and number of commits
0-6 Sunday - Saturday
0-23 Hour of day
Number of commits

For example, [2, 14, 25] indicates that there were 25 total commits, during
the 2.00pm hour on Tuesdays. All times are based on the time zone of
individual commits.
get_repos__owner___repo__stats_punch_car.description:
Get the number of commits per hour in each day.
Each array contains the day number, hour number, and number of commits
0-6 Sunday - Saturday
0-23 Hour of day
Number of commits

For example, [2, 14, 25] indicates that there were 25 total commits, during
the 2.00pm hour on Tuesdays. All times are based on the time zone of
individual commits.

get_repos__owner___repo__statuses__ref_.title: List Statuses for a specific Ref.
get_repos__owner___repo__statuses__ref_.description: List Statuses for a specific Ref.

get_repos__owner___repo___archive_format.title:
Get archive link.
This method will return a 302 to a URL to download a tarball or zipball
archive for a repository. Please make sure your HTTP framework is
configured to follow redirects or you will need to use the Location header
to make a second GET request.
Note: For private repositories, these links are temporary and expire quickly.
get_repos__owner___repo___archive_format.description:
Get archive link.
This method will return a 302 to a URL to download a tarball or zipball
archive for a repository. Please make sure your HTTP framework is
configured to follow redirects or you will need to use the Location header
to make a second GET request.
Note: For private repositories, these links are temporary and expire quickly.

get_repositories.title:
List all public repositories.
This provides a dump of every public repository, in the order that they
were created.
Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. is the
Link header to get the URL for the next page of repositories.
get_repositories.description:
List all public repositories.
This provides a dump of every public repository, in the order that they
were created.
Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. is the
Link header to get the URL for the next page of repositories.

get_search_issues.title: Find issues by state and keyword. (This method returns up to 100 results per page.)
get_search_issues.description: Find issues by state and keyword. (This method returns up to 100 results per page.)

delete_teams__teamId_.title:
Delete team.
In order to delete a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the
org that the team is associated with.
delete_teams__teamId_.description:
Delete team.
In order to delete a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the
org that the team is associated with.

patch_teams__teamId_.title:
Edit team.
In order to edit a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org
that the team is associated with.
patch_teams__teamId_.description:
Edit team.
In order to edit a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org
that the team is associated with.

get_teams__teamId__members.title:
List team members.
In order to list members in a team, the authenticated user must be a member
of the team.
get_teams__teamId__members.description:
List team members.
In order to list members in a team, the authenticated user must be a member
of the team.

delete_teams__teamId__members__username_.title:
The "Remove team member" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Remove team membership API instead. It allows you to remove both active and pending memberships.

Remove team member.
In order to remove a user from a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin'
permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated
with.
NOTE This does not delete the user, it just remove them from the team.
delete_teams__teamId__members__username_.description:
The "Remove team member" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Remove team membership API instead. It allows you to remove both active and pending memberships.

Remove team member.
In order to remove a user from a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin'
permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated
with.
NOTE This does not delete the user, it just remove them from the team.

get_teams__teamId__members__username_.title:
The "Get team member" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Get team membership API instead. It allows you to get both active and pending memberships.

Get team member.
In order to get if a user is a member of a team, the authenticated user mus
be a member of the team.
get_teams__teamId__members__username_.description:
The "Get team member" API is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Get team membership API instead. It allows you to get both active and pending memberships.

Get team member.
In order to get if a user is a member of a team, the authenticated user mus
be a member of the team.

put_teams__teamId__members__username_.title:
The API (described below) is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Add team membership API instead. It allows you to invite new organization members to your teams.

Add team member.
In order to add a user to a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin'
permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated
with.
put_teams__teamId__members__username_.description:
The API (described below) is deprecated and is scheduled for removal in the next major version of the API. We recommend using the Add team membership API instead. It allows you to invite new organization members to your teams.

Add team member.
In order to add a user to a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin'
permissions to the team or be an owner of the org that the team is associated
with.

delete_teams__teamId__memberships__usern.title:
Remove team membership.
In order to remove a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes their membership from the team.
delete_teams__teamId__memberships__usern.description:
Remove team membership.
In order to remove a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the user, it just removes their membership from the team.

get_teams__teamId__memberships__username.title:
Get team membership.
In order to get a user's membership with a team, the authenticated user must be a member of the team or an owner of the team's organization.
get_teams__teamId__memberships__username.description:
Get team membership.
In order to get a user's membership with a team, the authenticated user must be a member of the team or an owner of the team's organization.

put_teams__teamId__memberships__username.title:
Add team membership.
In order to add a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with.

If the user is already a part of the team's organization (meaning they're on at least one other team in the organization), this endpoint will add the user to the team.

If the user is completely unaffiliated with the team's organization (meaning they're on none of the organization's teams), this endpoint will send an invitation to the user via email. This newly-created membership will be in the 'pending' state until the user accepts the invitation, at which point the membership will transition to the 'active' state and the user will be added as a member of the team.
put_teams__teamId__memberships__username.description:
Add team membership.
In order to add a membership between a user and a team, the authenticated user must have 'admin' permissions to the team or be an owner of the organization that the team is associated with.

If the user is already a part of the team's organization (meaning they're on at least one other team in the organization), this endpoint will add the user to the team.

If the user is completely unaffiliated with the team's organization (meaning they're on none of the organization's teams), this endpoint will send an invitation to the user via email. This newly-created membership will be in the 'pending' state until the user accepts the invitation, at which point the membership will transition to the 'active' state and the user will be added as a member of the team.

delete_teams__teamId__repos__owner___rep.title: In order to remove a repository from a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the repository, it just removes it from the team.
delete_teams__teamId__repos__owner___rep.description: In order to remove a repository from a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. NOTE: This does not delete the repository, it just removes it from the team.

get_teams__teamId__repos__owner___repo_.title: Check if a team manages a repository
get_teams__teamId__repos__owner___repo_.description: Check if a team manages a repository

put_teams__teamId__repos__owner___repo_.title: In order to add a repository to a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. Also, the repository must be owned by the organization, or a direct fork of a repository owned by the organization.
put_teams__teamId__repos__owner___repo_.description: In order to add a repository to a team, the authenticated user must be an owner of the org that the team is associated with. Also, the repository must be owned by the organization, or a direct fork of a repository owned by the organization.

delete_user_emails.title:
Delete email address(es).
You can include a single email address or an array of addresses.
delete_user_emails.description:
Delete email address(es).
You can include a single email address or an array of addresses.

get_user_emails.title:
List email addresses for a user.
In the final version of the API, this method will return an array of hashes
with extended information for each email address indicating if the address
has been verified and if it's primary email address for GitHub.
Until API v3 is finalized, use the application/vnd.github.v3 media type to
get other response format.
get_user_emails.description:
List email addresses for a user.
In the final version of the API, this method will return an array of hashes
with extended information for each email address indicating if the address
has been verified and if it's primary email address for GitHub.
Until API v3 is finalized, use the application/vnd.github.v3 media type to
get other response format.

post_user_emails.title:
Add email address(es).
You can post a single email address or an array of addresses.
post_user_emails.description:
Add email address(es).
You can post a single email address or an array of addresses.

get_user_following.title: List who the authenticated user is following.
get_user_following.description: List who the authenticated user is following.

delete_user_following__username_.title:
Unfollow a user.
Unfollowing a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with
basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.
delete_user_following__username_.description:
Unfollow a user.
Unfollowing a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with
basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.

get_user_following__username_.title: Check if you are following a user.
get_user_following__username_.description: Check if you are following a user.

put_user_following__username_.title:
Follow a user.
Following a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with
basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.
put_user_following__username_.description:
Follow a user.
Following a user requires the user to be logged in and authenticated with
basic auth or OAuth with the user:follow scope.

get_user_issues.title:
List issues.
List all issues across owned and member repositories for the authenticated
user.
get_user_issues.description:
List issues.
List all issues across owned and member repositories for the authenticated
user.

get_user_keys.title:
List your public keys.
Lists the current user's keys. Management of public keys via the API requires
that you are authenticated through basic auth, or OAuth with the 'user', 'write:public_key' scopes.
get_user_keys.description:
List your public keys.
Lists the current user's keys. Management of public keys via the API requires
that you are authenticated through basic auth, or OAuth with the 'user', 'write:public_key' scopes.

delete_user_keys__keyId_.title: Delete a public key. Removes a public key. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth or via OAuth with at least admin:public_key scope.
delete_user_keys__keyId_.description: Delete a public key. Removes a public key. Requires that you are authenticated via Basic Auth or via OAuth with at least admin:public_key scope.

get_user_orgs.title: List public and private organizations for the authenticated user.
get_user_orgs.description: List public and private organizations for the authenticated user.

get_user_repos.title:
List repositories for the authenticated user. Note that this does not include
repositories owned by organizations which the user can access. You can lis
user organizations and list organization repositories separately.
get_user_repos.description:
List repositories for the authenticated user. Note that this does not include
repositories owned by organizations which the user can access. You can lis
user organizations and list organization repositories separately.

post_user_repos.title:
Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply
repo scope.
post_user_repos.description:
Create a new repository for the authenticated user. OAuth users must supply
repo scope.

get_user_starred.title: List repositories being starred by the authenticated user.
get_user_starred.description: List repositories being starred by the authenticated user.

get_user_starred__owner___repo_.description: Check if you are starring a repository.

get_user_subscriptions.title: List repositories being watched by the authenticated user.
get_user_subscriptions.description: List repositories being watched by the authenticated user.

get_user_subscriptions__owner___repo_.title: Check if you are watching a repository.
get_user_subscriptions__owner___repo_.description: Check if you are watching a repository.

get_user_teams.title: List all of the teams across all of the organizations to which the authenticated user belongs. This method requires user or repo scope when authenticating via OAuth.
get_user_teams.description: List all of the teams across all of the organizations to which the authenticated user belongs. This method requires user or repo scope when authenticating via OAuth.

get_users.title:
Get all users.
This provides a dump of every user, in the order that they signed up for GitHub.
Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. Use the Link
header to get the URL for the next page of users.
get_users.description:
Get all users.
This provides a dump of every user, in the order that they signed up for GitHub.
Note: Pagination is powered exclusively by the since parameter. Use the Link
header to get the URL for the next page of users.

get_users__username__events.title: If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.
get_users__username__events.description: If you are authenticated as the given user, you will see your private events. Otherwise, you'll only see public events.

get_users__username__events_orgs__org_.title: This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.
get_users__username__events_orgs__org_.description: This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

get_users__username__following__targetUs.description: Check if one user follows another.

List public keys for a user.
